sourceText: Hello! How are you doing? We are so happy that you have signed up to receive these messages. Today’s tip is about spending One-on-One Time with our babies.
text: Helo! Apa khabar? Kami sangat gembira kerana anda telah mendaftar untuk menerima mesej ini. Tip hari ini adalah untuk menghabiskan Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang dengan bayi.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: This builds a healthy attachment that will make them feel secure and loved.
text: Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang membina perapatan yang sihat yang akan membuat bayi merasa selamat dan disayangi.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: It is normal to struggle to think of what to do with our babies.
text: Adalah normal untuk sentiasa berjuang memikirkan apa yang harus dilakukan dengan bayi.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Here are 7 easy tips to make it a success:
text: Berikut adalah 7 tip mudah untuk menjayakannya:
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Step 1. Do it every day!
text: Langkah 1. Lakukan setiap hari!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Try to spend time playing with your baby every day, at a time when you are not distracted by others, your television or phone.
text: Cuba luangkan masa bermain dengan bayi anda setiap hari, pada masa anda tidak diganggu oleh orang lain, televisyen atau telefon.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Step 2. Be close to your child.
text: Langkah 2. Rapat dengan anak anda.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Skin-to-skin contact is especially important for new-borns and infants. For older toddlers, make sure you are at the same level as they are.
text: Sentuhan kulit-ke-kulit sangat penting untuk anak baru lahir dan bayi. Untuk kanak-kanak bertatih, pastikan anda berada pada aras yang sama seperti mereka.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Step 3. Let your baby take the lead
text: Langkah 3. Biarkan bayi anda memimpin
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Give them time to explore things in their own way and pace. Be patient and reassuring - the world is brand new to your child!
text: Beri mereka masa untuk meneroka sesuatu dengan cara dan langkah mereka sendiri. Bersabar dan yakinlah - dunia ini baru bagi anak anda!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Step 4. Observe your child.
text: Langkah 4. Perhatikan anak anda.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: See what your child is interested in or looking at. Notice their sounds, words and facial expressions, and try copying them!
text: Perhatikan apa yang anak anda minat atau pandang. Kenal pasti bunyi, perkataan dan ekspresi wajah mereka, dan cuba tiru perkara tersebut!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Step 5. Play with your baby
text: Langkah 5. Bermain dengan bayi anda
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Babies learn through play! Help your child explore the world through their five senses. It is okay for your child’s attention to wander to many different things. Just keep your attention on your child.
text: Bayi belajar sambil bermain! Bantu anak anda meneroka dunia melalui lima pancaindera mereka. Tidak mengapa perhatian anak anda mengembara ke pelbagai perkara. Tumpukan perhatian hanya kepada anak anda.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Step 6. Talk to your baby
text: Langkah 6. Bercakap dengan bayi anda
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Start talking to your baby from the moment they are born. Did you know your baby can even recognise their name at a very early age? Try saying your baby's name and notice how they respond!
text: Mulakan bercakap dengan bayi anda sejak mereka dilahirkan. Adakah anda tahu bayi anda boleh mengenali namanya pada usia yang sangat awal? Cuba sebutkan nama bayi anda dan perhatikan bagaimana mereka bertindak balas!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Use words to describe everything around you: your child’s actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds.
text: Gunakan perkataan untuk menerangkan segala yang ada di sekitar anda: aksi bayi anda, warna, bentuk, angka, ukuran, tekstur, suhu, rasa dan bunyi.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Step 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!
text: Langkah 7. Anda boleh mempunyai masa yang berkualiti dengan bayi anda pada bila-bila masa!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Connect with your baby playfully during feeding, bathing, and dressing, or calmly at bedtime.
text: Berhubung dengan bayi anda dengan ceria semasa memberi dia makan, mandi, dan memakaikan pakaian, atau dengan tenang pada waktu tidur.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Congratulations! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Quality time with your children is the best gift that you can ever give them.
text: Tahniah! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Masa yang berkualiti dengan anak-anak anda adalah hadiah terbaik yang dapat anda berikan kepada mereka.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time – Babies

sourceText: Hello! How are you doing? Today’s tip is about spending One-on-One Time with our children.
text: Helo! Apa khabar? Tip hari ini ialah tentang menghabiskan Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang dengan anak-anak.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: It’s free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and also increases their confidence and self-esteem!
text: Ia adalah percuma dan menyeronokkan. Ia menjadikan anak-anak merasa disayangi dan selamat, dan juga meningkatkan keyakinan dan estim diri mereka!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Here are 6 tips to make it a success:
text: Berikut adalah 6 tip untuk menjayakannya:
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Step 1. Spend at least 5 minutes with each child
text: Langkah 1. Luangkan sekurang-kurangnya 5 minit dengan setiap anak
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Even 5 minutes a day of quality time makes a big difference. It can be at the same time each day so your children look forward to it.
text: Walaupun hanya selama 5 minit sehari untuk masa berkualiti bersama anak, ia tetap boleh memberikan perbezaan yang besar. Ia boleh dilakukan pada waktu yang sama setiap hari sehingga anak-anak anda ternanti-nantikannya.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Step 2. Give your child your full attention
text: Langkah 2. Beri perhatian penuh kepada anak anda
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Make sure you will not be interrupted. Switch off the TV and put your phone on silent. It will show your child, they are important.
text: Pastikan anda tidak akan terganggu. Matikan TV dan telefon anda hendaklah berada dalam mod senyap. Ini akan menunjukkan kepada anak anda bahawa mereka penting.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Step 3. Let your child choose the activity
text: Langkah 3. Biarkan anak anda memilih aktiviti
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Ask your child what they would like to do. You can say, "I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you, what would you like to do?”
text: Tanyakan kepada anak anda apa yang ingin mereka lakukan. Anda boleh mengatakan, "Saya mempunyai 5 minit untuk menghabiskan Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang dengan anda, apa yang anda mahu lakukan?"
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Choosing builds their self-confidence. If they want to do something that isn’t OK with COVID-19 rules, then this is a chance to talk with them about this. If your child cannot think of anything, you can give them a choice of a couple things that you know they like.
text: Memilih boleh membina keyakinan diri anak. Sekiranya mereka ingin melakukan sesuatu yang tidak sesuai dengan peraturan COVID-19, maka ini adalah peluang untuk bercakap dengan mereka mengenai perkara ini. Sekiranya anak anda tidak dapat memikirkan apa-apa, anda boleh memberi mereka beberapa pilihan perkara yang anda tahu mereka suka.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Step 4. Follow your child's lead
text: Langkah 4. Ikut pimpinan anak anda
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative.
text: Kanak-kanak perlu melakukan sesuatu mengikut masa mereka sendiri. Cuba beri mereka masa untuk meneroka dan bersabar. Main bersama dan tiru apa yang mereka lakukan tetapi cuba biarkan mereka terus berinisiatif.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Step 5. Use words to describe what your child is doing
text: Langkah 5. Gunakan perkataan untuk menerangkan apa yang anak anda lakukan
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Listening to your child is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what your child is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!
text: Mendengar anak anda adalah lebih penting daripada bercakap dengan mereka pada masa ini. Sekiranya anda bercakap, anda harus menerangkan apa yang anak anda lakukan. Gunakan perkataan untuk menerangkan tindakan, warna, bentuk, angka, ukuran, tekstur, suhu, rasa, bunyi, dan apa sahaja yang berlaku!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Step 6. Have fun!
text: Langkah 6. Bergembiralah!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: One-on-One Time with your child can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after playing with your child.
text: Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang dengan anak anda juga boleh menggembirakan anda! Anda mungkin merasa kurang tertekan setelah bermain dengan anak anda.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Congratulations! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Quality time with your children is the best gift that you can ever give them.
text: Tahniah! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Masa yang berkualiti dengan anak-anak anda adalah hadiah terbaik yang dapat anda berikan kepada mereka.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Children

sourceText: Hello! How are you doing? Today’s tip is about spending One-on-One Time with our teens.
text: Helo! Apa khabar? Tip hari ini adalah tentang menghabiskan Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang dengan remaja.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: When we have difficult relationships with our teenagers,  we spend a lot of time disciplining or complaining about them.
text: Apabila kita mempunyai hubungan yang sukar dengan remaja, kita menghabiskan banyak masa untuk mendisiplinkan atau merungut tentang mereka.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: One-on-One Time helps build a positive, trusting relationship. When you really show interest in them, you make them feel valued and appreciated.
text: Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang membantu membina hubungan positif dan saling mempercayai. Apabila anda benar-benar menunjukkan minat terhadap mereka, anda membuat mereka merasa bernilai dan dihargai.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Here are 6 tips to make One-on-One Time a positive experience for you and your teen:
text: Berikut adalah 6 tip untuk menjadikan Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang sebagai pengalaman positif bagi anda dan anak remaja anda:
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Step 1. Do it every day
text: Langkah 1. Lakukan setiap hari
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Set aside a time each day when you and our teen will not be interrupted and when your teen does not have something else they want to do. Switch off television and phones so you will not be interrupted.
text: Luangkan masa setiap hari apabila anda dan anak remaja tidak terganggu dan ketika anak remaja tidak mempunyai perkara lain yang ingin mereka lakukan. Matikan televisyen dan telefon supaya anda tidak terganggu.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Step 2. Let your teen choose the activity
text: Langkah 2. Biarkan anak remaja anda memilih aktiviti
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. Your teen might think this is weird at first, but will come to enjoy having this dedicated time with you!
text: Beritahu anak remaja anda bahawa anda ingin meluangkan masa bersama mereka dan mereka boleh memilih apa yang hendak dilakukan atau dibualkan. Anak remaja anda mungkin menganggap ini pelik pada mulanya, tetapi beliau akan menikmati masa yang istimewa ini dengan anda!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Step 3. Follow your teen's lead
text: Langkah 3. Ikuti pimpinan anak remaja
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Remember this is your teen's activity. Accept their suggestions, show interest, and say something nice.
text: Ingat ini adalah aktiviti anak remaja anda. Terima cadangan mereka, tunjukkan minat, dan katakan sesuatu yang baik.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Step 4. Give your teen all of your attention.
text: Langkah 4. Beri perhatian penuh kepada anak remaja.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Look at your teen. Nodding or saying “I see” shows you are really paying attention. Accept what they are saying without judging them.
text: Pandang anak remaja anda. Mengangguk atau mengatakan "Saya/Ibu/Ayah faham" menunjukkan anda benar-benar memberikan perhatian. Terimalah apa yang mereka katakan tanpa menilai mereka.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Step 5. Show your teen you are really listening
text: Langkah 5. Tunjukkan pada anak remaja bahawa anda benar-benar mendengar
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: To make them feel supported, you can even try rephrasing what they said: “Yeah, I see that you find that difficult/fun/confusing/exciting.”
text: Untuk membuat mereka merasa disokong, anda juga boleh mencuba mengulang kembali kata-kata mereka: "Ya, saya/ibu/ayah faham yang anda dapati ianya sukar/seronok/ mengelirukan/mengasyikkan."
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Step 6. Have fun!
text: Langkah 6. Bergembiralah!
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: One-on-One Time with your teen can be fun for you, too! It might even make you feel less stressed.
text: Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang dengan anak remaja juga boleh menyeronokkan anda! Malah mungkin membuat anda merasa kurang tertekan.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Congratulations! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Quality time with your children is the best gift that you can ever give them.
text: Tahniah! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Masa yang berkualiti dengan anak-anak anda adalah hadiah terbaik yang dapat anda berikan kepada mereka.
note: This is for topic One-on-One Time - Teens

sourceText: Hello! Managing our children's behaviour can be challenging…even in the best of times. We sometimes do not notice when our children are behaving well. But when they are misbehaving, it can be a nightmare!
text: Helo! Menguruskan tingkah laku anak-anak boleh mencabar… walaupun pada masa-masa terbaik. Kita kadang-kadang tidak menyedari ketika anak-anak berkelakuan baik. Tetapi apabila mereka berkelakuan tidak baik, itu boleh menjadi mimpi buruk!
note: This is for topic Keeping it Positive

sourceText: Today's Tip is all about Child Behaviour. There are 2 main ways that we can help our children behave positively more often.
text: Tip hari ini adalah mengenai Tingkah laku Anak. Terdapat 2 cara utama untuk membantu anak-anak bersikap positif dengan lebih kerap.
note: This is for topic Keeping it Positive

sourceText: First, we can find ways to encourage our children to behave well more often. Spending One-on-One Time with them is an important first step!
text: Pertama, kita boleh mencari cara untuk mendorong anak-anak kita berkelakuan lebih baik. Menghabiskan Masa Seorang-Bersama-Seorang dengan mereka adalah langkah pertama yang penting!
note: This is for topic Keeping it Positive

sourceText: Second, we can learn effective ways to manage difficult behaviours in a loving but firm way.
text: Kedua, kita dapat mempelajari cara-cara yang berkesan untuk menguruskan tingkah laku sukar dengan cara yang penuh kasih sayang tetapi tegas.
note: This is for topic Keeping it Positive

sourceText: These suggestions are from over 50 years of research on what works. But don't take our word for it, try them out and decide for yourself. And remember...practice makes perfect!
text: Cadangan ini adalah daripada penyelidikan lebih dari 50 tahun mengenai kaedah yang berjaya. Tetapi jangan ambil kata-kata kami, cubalah dan tentukan sendiri. Dan ingat... latihan menjadikan ianya sempurna!
note: This is for topic Keeping it Positive

sourceText: Well done! You have added another tool to your Parenting Toolkit.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah alat lain ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda.
note: This is for topic Keeping it Positive

sourceText: It‘s hard to feel positive when our kids or teenagers are driving us crazy. We often end up saying “Stop doing that!” But children are much more likely to do what we ask if we give them positive instructions and lots of praise for what they do right.
text: Sukar untuk merasa positif apabila anak-anak kecil atau remaja membuat kita gila. Kita sering mengatakan "Berhenti melakukannya!" Tetapi anak-anak lebih cenderung melakukan apa yang kita minta sekiranya kita memberi arahan positif dan banyak memuji mereka bagi perkara elok yang mereka lakukan.
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Here are 4 steps to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often:
text: Berikut adalah 4 langkah untuk membantu anak-anak anda mengikuti arahan anda dengan lebih kerap:
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Step 1. Get Your Child's Attention
text: Langkah 1. Dapatkan Perhatian Anak Anda
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Look at your child and say their name when you give your child an instruction. Get down to their level.
text: Pandang anak anda dan sebutkan namanya semasa anda memberi arahan kepada anak anda. Turun ke paras mereka.
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Step 2. Be Specific, Positive, and Realistic!
text: Langkah 2. Jadilah Spesifik, Positif, dan Realistik!
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Describe exactly what you want your child to do. Say, 'Please wash your hands for 20 seconds before coming to dinner, instead of 'Wash your hands.'
text: Huraikan dengan tepat apa yang anda mahu anak anda lakukan. Katakan, 'Sila basuh tangan anda selama 20 saat sebelum makan malam, dan bukannya 'Basuh tangan anda.'
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Use positive words when telling your child what to do. Say, ‘Please put your clothes away in the cupboard,’ instead of ‘Don’t make a mess’.
text: Gunakan perkataan yang positif apabila memberitahu anak anda apa yang perlu dilakukannya. Katakan, 'Tolong letakkan pakaian kamu di dalam almari,' berbanding 'Jangan buat sepah'.
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Can your child actually do what you are asking them? It is very hard for a child to keep quiet inside for a whole day but maybe they can keep quiet for 15 minutes.
text: Bolehkah anak anda benar-benar lakukan apa yang anda suruh? Adalah sukar untuk kanak-kanak duduk diam di dalam rumah sepanjang hari tetapi mungkin mereka boleh diam untuk tempoh 15 minit.
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Step 3. Give Instructions One at a Time
text: Langkah 3. Berikan Satu Arahan pada satu Masa
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Children are much more likely to do what you ask if you break things up into smaller steps.
text: Kanak-kanak lebih suka melakukan apa yang anda suruh sekiranya anda membahagikan perkara tersebut kepada beberapa langkah yang lebih kecil.
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Step 4. Praise Your Children When They Follow Instructions
text: Langkah 4. Puji Anak-anak Anda Apabila Mereka Menurut Arahan
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: They will feel good about it and be more likely to follow instructions in the future!
text: Mereka akan berasa bagus dengan perkara tersebut dan cenderung untuk menurut arahan pada masa akan datang!
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Well done! You have added another tool to your Parenting Toolkit. In summary…
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi alat dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Sebagai rumusan...
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: 1. Get their attention
text: 1. Dapatkan perhatian mereka
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: 2. Be positive, specific, and realistic
text: 2. Jadilah positif, spesifik, dan realistik
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: 3. One instruction at a time
text: 3. Satu arahan pada satu masa
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: 4. Praise them for doing it!
text: 4. Puji mereka sebab melakukannya!
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: It will make a HUGE DIFFERENCE if you can learn these 4 simple steps!
text: Ia akan menghasilkan satu PERUBAHAN BESAR sekiranya anda boleh menguasai 4 langkah mudah ini!
note: This is for topic Positive instructions

sourceText: Hi! I just wanted to thank you for making this commitment to improve the life of your children. It shows you really care!
text: Hai! Saya hanya mahu mengucapkan terima kasih kepada anda kerana memberikan komitmen untuk memperbaiki kehidupan anak-anak anda. Ia menunjukkan anda benar-benar mengambil berat!
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Today's Parenting Tip is all about Praise.
text: Tip Keibubapaan Hari Ini adalah tentang Pujian.
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: We all appreciate it when the good things we do are recognised by others, especially when it is someone who is close to us.
text: Kita semua menghargainya apabila perkara baik yang kita lakukan diperakui oleh orang lain, terutamanya apabila seseorang yang rapat dengan kita.
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Praise works for our children, too. When you bring more attention to positive behaviour, they are likely to do it more often. They also will feel good about themselves!
text: Pujian berkesan terhadap anak-anak kita, juga. Apabila anda memberi perhatian yang lebih kepada tingkah laku yang positif, mereka lebih cenderung untuk melakukannya lebih kerap. Mereka juga akan berasa lebih bagus tentang diri mereka!
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Here are 3 simple steps to get it right:
text: Ini adalah 3 langkah mudah untuk melakukannya dengan betul:
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Step 1. Praise your child or teenager for something they have done well. They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Langkah 1. Puji anak kecil atau anak remaja anda untuk sesuatu yang telah mereka lakukan dengan baik. Mereka mungkin tidak menunjukkannya, tetapi anda akan melihat mereka melakukan perkara yang baik itu lagi. Ia juga memastikan mereka sedar bahawa anda perasan dan mengambil berat.
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Step 2. Praise the behaviour. Use words to describe the behaviour that you are praising. Say, 'Well done for finishing all your chores, Sam,' instead of 'Good job.'
text: Langkah 2. Puji tingkah laku tersebut. Gunakan perkataan untuk memperihalkan tingkah laku yang anda puji. Katakan, 'Syabas kerana menyelesaikan semua kerja kamu, Sam,' berbanding 'Kerja yang bagus.'
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Step 3. Praise with enthusiasm. Really mean it when you say it!
text: Langkah 3. Puji dengan bersemangat. Benar-benar maksudkan apabila anda menyatakannya!
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Try to find 3 things that you can praise your children for every day. You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!
text: Syabas kerana menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Cuba cari 3 perkara yang anda boleh puji anak-anak anda setiap hari. Anda juga boleh memuji orang dewasa lain yang berada di dalam rumah anda. Lihat bagaimana mereka bertindak balas!
note: This is for topic Praise

sourceText: Hello! COVID-19 has interrupted our daily work, home and school routines. This is hard for children, teenagers and for you. Making new routines can help.
text: Helo! COVID-19 telah mengganggu kerja harian kita, rutin di rumah dan sekolah. Ini adalah sukar bagi kanak-kanak, remaja dan anda. Mewujudkan rutin baharu boleh membantu.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Today's Parenting Tip is about how we can create daily routines with our children.
text: Tip Keibubapaan pada hari ini adalah bagaimana kita dapat menghasilkan rutin harian bersama anak-anak kita.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Daily routines, such as time for schoolwork, play, meals, and sleep, can help our children feel safe and secure. They also give our children a sense of security that they need to grow and develop.
text: Rutin harian, contohnya masa untuk kerja sekolah, bermain, makan, dan tidur dapat membantu anak-anak kita berasa selamat dan terjamin. Ia juga membuatkan anak-anak kita berasa selamat untuk membesar dan berkembang.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Help your younger children learn routines by taking them through the activity step by step. Give one instruction at a time. Praise them each time they follow!
text: Bantulah anak-anak kecil anda untuk belajar rutin dengan melakukan aktiviti secara langkah demi langkah. Beri satu arahan pada satu masa. Beri pujian kepada mereka setiap kali mereka ikut!
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Transition warnings can also be very helpful. They give your child some time to prepare for the next activity: "In 5 minutes it will be time to pack up the toys before dinner..."
text: Amaran peralihan juga boleh jadi sangat membantu. Ia memberikan anak anda masa untuk bersedia bagi aktiviti selanjutnya: "Lagi 5 minit adalah masa untuk kemaskan barang-barang mainan sebelum makan malam..."
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Regular eating and sleeping times are especially important for babies. Not enough sleep can make your child cranky, irritable, and short tempered.
text: Makan dan tidur yang teratur adalah penting terutamanya untuk bayi. Tidur yang tidak cukup boleh menyebabkan anak anda resah, mudah terasa, dan cepat marah.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Here are some tips for how to help your child prepare for bedtime:
text: Berikut adalah beberapa tip tentang bagaimana membantu anak anda membuat persediaan untuk waktu tidur:
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: 1. Try to have regular bedtimes each day as much as possible.
text: 1. Cuba untuk mengamalkan waktu tidur yang teratur setiap hari sekerap yang mungkin.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: 2. Try to make it quiet and the lights in the room dim.
text: 2. Cuba wujudkan suasana senyap dan malapkan lampu di dalam bilik.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: 3. Spend some time with your child. You can sing a lullaby or tell a calm story.
text: 3. Luangkan sedikit masa dengan anak anda. Anda boleh dodoikan dengan nyanyian atau sampaikan cerita yang menenangkan.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: 4. Give your child a hug and kiss goodnight before leaving the room.
text: 4. Berikan anak anda pelukan dan ciuman selamat malam sebelum meninggalkan bilik.
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Involve your teen in creating daily plans. Set goals and rewards together. They can plan when they do schoolwork and when they relax!
text: Libatkan anak remaja anda dalam menyediakan rancangan harian. Tentukan matlamat dan ganjaran bersama-sama. Mereka boleh rancang waktu untuk membuat kerja sekolah dan bila untuk bersantai!
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Well done! You have added another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Here are some suggestions for routines that you could establish with your children:
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Berikut adalah beberapa cadangan rutin untuk anda hasilkan bersama anak-anak anda:
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Bedtime
text: Waktu tidur
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Schoolwork
text: Kerja sekolah
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Chores
text: Kerja-kerja di rumah
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Mealtime
text: Waktu makan
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Play/free time
text: Bermain/waktu lapang
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: T.V. or gadget time
text: T.V. atau masa gajet
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Storytime
text: Masa bercerita
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: One-on-One Time
text: Masa Bersama Seorang-dengan-Seorang
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: You can add more, too!
text: Anda juga boleh tambah lagi!
note: This is for topic Structure Up

sourceText: Hello! Today's Parenting Tip is about how we can involve our children in creating consistent household rules.
text: Helo! Tip Keibubapaan hari ini adalah tentang bagaimana kita boleh melibatkan anak-anak kita dalam menghasilkan peraturan isi rumah yang konsisten.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: Household rules can help children feel secure and keep them safe from potential dangers both inside the house and in the community. They also help children to know what kind of behaviour is expected from them.
text: Peraturan isi rumah dapat membantu anak-anak berasa terjamin dan menyelamatkan mereka daripada potensi bahaya dari dalam rumah dan komuniti. Ia juga membantu anak-anak untuk mengetahui jenis tingkah laku yang dijangkakan terhadap mereka.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: Here are 6 simple tips on how you can make household rules with your children and teens:
text: Ini adalah 6 tip mudah bagaimana anda dapat membuat peraturan isi rumah dengan anak kecil dan anak remaja anda:
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: 1. Involve your child in establishing household rules.
text: 1. Libatkan anak anda dalam membuat peraturan isi rumah.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: 2. Make your household rules clear and specific.
text: 2. Jadikan peraturan isi rumah anda jelas dan spesifik.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: 3. Make sure your child understands the reasons why you are establishing a household rule.
text: 3. Pastikan anak anda faham sebab kenapa anda membuat peraturan isi rumah.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: 4. Make your household rules fair and realistic (just like instructions).
text: 4. Pastikan peraturan dalam rumah anda adil dan realistik (sama seperti arahan).
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: 5. Praise and simple incentives can help support your child in following a household rule.
text: 5. Pujian dan insentif yang mudah boleh menyokong anak anda untuk mematuhi peraturan isi rumah.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: 6. Add only 1 household rule at a time.
text: 6. Tambah 1 sahaja peraturan isi rumah dalam satu masa.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: Well done! You have added another tool to your Parenting Toolkit. Remember when you involve your children in establishing household rules, they are more likely to follow them. Try to be consistent and positive.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi alat dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Ingat apabila anda melibatkan anak-anak anda dalam membuat peraturan isi rumah, mereka akan cenderung untuk mematuhinya. Cuba untuk konsisten dan positif.
note: This is for topic Household Rules

sourceText: Hello! All children misbehave sometimes. It is normal when they are tired, scared, hungry, or learning independence. Today's tips are all about what to do when our children misbehave…
text: Helo! Semua kanak-kanak kadang-kadang berkelakuan kurang baik. Ia adalah sesuatu yang normal apabila mereka letih, takut, lapar, atau sedang belajar berdikari. Tip hari ini adalah tentang apa yang perlu dibuat apabila anak-anak kita berkelakuan kurang baik...
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 1 Redirect

sourceText: Stop it before it starts! When your children get restless, you can distract them with something interesting or fun: "Come, let's play a game together!"
text: Hentikannya sebelum ia bermula! Apabila anak-anak anda gelisah, anda boleh mengganggu tumpuan mereka dengan sesuatu yang menarik dan menghiburkan: "Marilah, mari bermain satu permainan bersama-sama!"
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 1 Redirect

sourceText: Keep it positive. It’s normal to want to say something about your child's negative behaviour, like “Don’t whine,” or “Stop running in the house.” Instead, just say something that you want your child to do, like "Speak with a calm voice," or "Remember to walk inside the house."
text: Sentiasa positif. Adalah normal untuk menyatakan sesuatu tentang tingkah laku negatif anak anda, contohnya "Jangan merengek," atau "Berhenti berlari di dalam rumah." Sebaliknya, cuma nyatakan apa yang anda mahu anak anda lakukan, contohnya "Cakap dengan suara yang tenang," atau "Ingat untuk berjalan di dalam rumah."
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 1 Redirect

sourceText: If your baby is starting to crawl or walk, you can also redirect them by physically picking them up and focusing their attention on something else interesting. Use a lively and cheerful voice!
text: Jika bayi anda mula merangkak atau berjalan, anda juga boleh mengubah hala mereka dengan mengangkat mereka secara fizikal dan memfokuskan perhatian mereka kepada sesuatu yang lain yang menarik. Gunakan suara yang bertenaga dan ceria!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 1 Redirect

sourceText: Well done! You have added another tool to your Parenting Toolkit. Remember that redirecting your children only works before or at the beginning of a bad behaviour. You can also always type "Help" for more tips. Have a great day!
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi bahan dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Ingatlah bahawa mengubah hala anak-anak anda hanya berkesan sebelum atau pada permulaan tingkah laku yang tidak baik. Anda sentiasa boleh taip "Tolong" untuk lebih tip. Semoga anda menikmati hari yang hebat!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 1 Redirect

sourceText: Hello! Today we are going to learn what we can do when our children are already misbehaving or have  misbehaved…
text: Helo! Hari ini kita akan belajar tentang apa yang boleh kita lakukan apabila anak-anak kita berkelakuan tidak baik atau pernah melakukan perlakuan tidak baik...
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: Instead of hitting or shouting, there are other ways to discipline your children like using consequences…and they work well!
text: Berbanding memukul dan menjerit, ada cara lain untuk mendisiplinkan anak-anak anda seperti menggunakan akibat...dan ianya berkesan!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: Here are 5 tips for how to use consequences effectively:
text: Ini adalah 5 tip bagaimana untuk menggunakan akibat secara berkesan:
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 1. Give your child a choice to follow your instruction before giving them the consequence.
text: 1. Berikan pilihan kepada anak anda untuk mematuhi arahan anda sebelum memberikan mereka akibat.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 2. Try to stay calm but firm when giving the consequence.
text: 2. Cuba kekal bertenang tetapi tegas apabila memberikan mereka akibat.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: If you start yelling, it will just make things worse. Take a deep breath before responding.
text: Sekiranya anda mula menjerit, ia akan menyebabkan situasi menjadi lebih teruk. Tarik nafas dalam-dalam sebelum memberi tindak balas.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 3. Be realistic and follow through
text: 3. Jadilah realistik dan teruskan sehingga selesai
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, take away a teenager’s phone for one hour instead of a week.
text: Pastikan anda boleh teruskan dengan akibat berkenaan. Sebagai contoh, mengambil telefon remaja selama satu jam berbanding satu minggu.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 4. Reconnect afterwards
text: 4. Menyambung kembali selepasnya
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: Once the consequence is over, give your child a chance to do something good, and praise them for it.
text: Apabila akibat berakhir, berikan peluang kepada anak anda untuk melakukan sesuatu yang baik, dan puji mereka untuk perlakuan tersebut.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 5. Consequences for breaking rules
text: 5. Akibat kerana ketidakpatuhan terhadap peraturan
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: Consequences can also be used when your children forget a household rule.
text: Akibat boleh juga digunakan apabila anak-anak anda terlupa peraturan isi rumah.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: For example: “Either you do your schoolwork before dinner, or you cannot watch your favourite T.V. show tonight.”.
text: Sebagai contoh: "Sama ada kamu melakukan kerja sekolah sebelum makan malam, atau kamu tidak boleh menonton rancangan T.V. kegemaran kamu malam ini."
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: In summary, consequences should be...
text: Ringkasnya, akibat sepatutnya...
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 1. Realistic: Consider the age of your child
text: 1. Realistik: Pertimbangkan umur anak anda
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 2. Immediate: Give them as soon as possible
text: 2. Segera: Beri mereka secepat mungkin
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 3. Fair: Make sure the consequence is not too harsh
text: 3. Sederhana: Pastikan akibatnya tidak terlalu keras
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 4. Consistent: Make sure you can follow through if you have to
text: 4. Konsisten: Pastikan anda dapat terus mengikutinya jika perlu
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: 5. The last resort: Try to encourage positive behaviour to happen more often!
text: 5. Langkah terakhir: Cuba galakkan tingkah laku positif lebih kerap berlaku!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Using consequences can help teach children self-discipline, independence, decision-making, and responsibility. They help children learn that their actions will have an impact on themselves and others. It is an important step to prepare them for their life outside of the family as they get older.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Menggunakan akibat dapat membantu mengajar anak-anak mendisiplinkan diri, berdikari, membuat keputusan, dan tanggungjawab. Ia membantu anak-anak belajar bahawa tindakan mereka akan memberi kesan kepada diri mereka sendiri dan orang lain. Ini adalah satu langkah penting untuk mempersiapkan mereka untuk kehidupan di luar ketika mereka semakin membesar.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 2 Consequences

sourceText: Hello! Your child can learn a lot by looking at simple pictures in books, magazines, or newspapers together with you!
text: Helo! Anak anda boleh belajar banyak dengan melihat gambar-gambar ringkas di dalam buku, majalah, atau surat khabar bersama anda!
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Here are some tips to guide you:
text: Berikut adalah beberapa tip untuk membimbing anda:
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: 1. Follow your child’s interest
text: 1. Ikut minat anak anda
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: When your child shows interest in a picture (pointing, patting, looking), talk about what has attracted your child’s interest.
text: Apabila anak anda menunjukkan minat terhadap gambar (menunjuk, menepuk, melihat), berbual tentang perkara yang menarik minat anak anda.
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: 2. Use a lively voice
text: 2. Gunakan suara yang bersemangat
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: This will help to keep the child’s attention on the book.
text: Ini akan membantu mengekalkan tumpuan anak terhadap buku.
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: 3. Point, name and repeat
text: 3. Tunjuk, namakan dan ulang
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Pointing to and naming an object or person in the book will help your child learn new words. Children learn through repetition, so look for other opportunities to use that word.
text: Menunjuk dan menamakan objek atau orang di dalam buku akan membantu anak anda mempelajari perkataan baru. Kanak-kanak belajar melalui pengulangan, maka cari peluang lain untuk menggunakan perkataan tersebut.
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: 4. Be positive and supportive
text: 4. Jadi positif dan menyokong
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Always respond positively to what your child says:  If your child points to a red apple and says “Tomato”, you can say “Yes, you’re right, it’s red - it's an apple!”
text: Sentiasa beri respon positif terhadap apa yang anak anda katakan: Jika anak anda menunjuk ke arah sebiji epal merah dan mengatakan "Tomato", anda boleh mengatakan "Ya, anda betul, itu merah - ia adalah epal!"
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: 5. Making actions and links
text: 5. Membuat tindakan dan hubungan
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Connect things in the book with things your child knows. If someone in the book is waving, you and your child can do the same.
text: Kaitkan perkara di dalam buku dengan perkara yang anak anda tahu. Sekiranya watak di dalam buku melambaikan tangan, anda dan anak anda boleh melakukan perkara yang sama.
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: 6. Talking about feelings
text: 6. Bercakap tentang perasaan
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Use what is happening in the book to help your child understand emotion words (happy, sad, angry, scared). Use your face and voice. Talk about your child’s own feelings, and why other people might feel a certain way:
text: Gunakan apa yang berlaku di dalam buku untuk membantu anak anda memahami perkataan emosi (gembira, sedih, marah, takut). Gunakan wajah dan suara anda. Bercakap tentang perasaan anak anda, dan mengapa orang lain mungkin merasakan cara yang tertentu:
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: “Look, she is smiling. Why do you think she is smiling? What made you smile today?”
text: "Lihat, dia tersenyum. Kenapa anda fikir dia tersenyum? Apa yang membuat anda tersenyum hari ini? "
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: 7. Babies and Books!
text: 7. Bayi dan Buku!
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Even very young babies enjoy book-sharing and it helps their development and learning.  It’s okay for them to put the book in their mouth - they are exploring!
text: Malah bayi juga suka berkongsi buku dan ini membantu perkembangan dan pembelajaran mereka. Tidak mengapa jika mereka memasukkan buku ke dalam mulut - mereka sedang meneroka!
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Well done! You have added another tool to your Parenting Toolbox! Sharing books will help your child to learn to speak, think, and focus better. It will also help them to understand feelings, which will make them get along with others better.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah alat lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Berkongsi buku akan membantu anak anda belajar bercakap, berfikir, dan fokus dengan lebih baik. Ia juga akan membantu mereka memahami perasaan, yang akan menjadikan pergaulan mereka dengan orang lain bertambah baik.
note: This is for topic Shared Book Reading

sourceText: Hello! Most parents struggle when their children have temper tantrums and other demanding behaviours.
text: Helo! Sebilangan besar ibu bapa merasa sukar apabila anak mereka membuat perangai dan bertingkah laku mendesak yang lain.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Here are 6 steps, you can try to make it happen less often!
text: Berikut adalah 6 langkah, anda boleh cuba mengurangkannya daripada berlaku!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: 1. Try to redirect your child's attention
text: 1. Cuba alih perhatian anak anda
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: When they start demanding or whining, first try to redirect them to a positive behaviour or activity and praise them!
text: Apabila mereka mula mendesak atau merengek, mula-mula cuba arahkan mereka kepada tingkah laku atau aktiviti positif dan puji mereka!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: 2. Make sure it is a behaviour you can ignore
text: 2. Pastikan ianya adalah tingkah laku yang boleh anda abaikan
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Ignore negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours, like whining, demanding, showing off, and tantrums. If we respond or give in to these behaviours, children learn that this will get them attention and what they want.
text: Abaikan tingkah laku mencari dan menuntut perhatian secara negatif, seperti merengek, mendesak, menunjuk-nunjuk, dan mengamuk. Sekiranya kita memberikan tindak balas atau menurut tingkah laku ini, kanak-kanak belajar bahawa ini akan memberi mereka perhatian dan apa yang mereka kehendaki.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: 3. Ignore the behaviour not your child.
text: 3. Abaikan tingkah laku, bukan anak anda.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Ignoring means removing physical and verbal attention. Take a Pause, stay calm, and be aware of what your child is doing.
text: Mengabaikan bermaksud mengalihkan perhatian fizikal dan lisan. Berhenti seketika, bertenang, dan perhatikan apa yang anak anda lakukan.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: 4. Praise your child immediately for the next positive behaviour
text: 4. Segera puji anak anda untuk tingkah laku positif seterusnya
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Having a tantrum is difficult for your child too. As soon as your child has calmed down, involve themin a positive activity. You can talk about what happened later, but right now your child needs love.
text: Mengamuk juga sukar bagi anak anda. Sebaik sahaja anak anda tenang, libatkan mereka dalam aktiviti positif. Anda boleh bercakap tentang apa yang telah berlaku kemudian, tetapi sekarang anak anda memerlukan kasih sayang.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: 5. Be consistent when ignoring
text: 5. Bersikap konsisten ketika mengabaikan
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Your child’s response might get worse when you first start using ignore. They are trying to test you! Continue to ignore the behaviour!
text: Tindak balas anak anda mungkin bertambah buruk apabila anda mula-mula mengabaikannya. Mereka cuba menguji anda! Terus abaikan tingkah laku tersebut!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Over time, your child will learn that it no longer works.
text: Lama-kelamaan, anak anda akan belajar bahawa ia tidak lagi berkesan.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: 6. Make sure you are giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times
text: 6. Pastikan anda memberi perhatian positif yang banyak kepada anak anda pada waktu lain juga
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: If you find yourself ignoring your child's behaviour a lot, you are not being consistent (sometimes ignoring and sometimes giving in) OR you are not spending enough positive time with your child. One-on-One Time is super important!
text: Sekiranya anda sering mengabaikan tingkah laku anak, anda tidak konsisten (kadang-kadang mengabaikan dan kadang-kadang menyerah) ATAU anda tidak meluangkan masa positif yang secukupnya dengan anak anda. Masa bersama Seorang-Dengan Seorang adalah sangat penting!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda.
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Ignoring negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours is not easy. But if you are patient, it really works. You can do this!
text: Mengabaikan tingkah laku mencari dan menuntut perhatian yang negatif tidaklah mudah. Tetapi jika anda bersabar, ia benar-benar berkesan. Anda boleh melakukannya!
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 3 Ignore

sourceText: Hello! Today's tip is about how we can help our children learn how to solve problems and conflicts.
text: Helo! Tip hari ini adalah bagaimana kita dapat membantu anak-anak kita belajar menyelesaikan masalah dan konflik.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: Challenges are stressful. But problem-solving can really help. There are 6 basic steps for problem solving:
text: Cabaran adalah tekanan. Tetapi penyelesaian masalah benar-benar dapat membantu. Terdapat 6 langkah asas untuk menyelesaikan masalah:
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: Here are 6 basic steps of problem solving with your teen:
text: Berikut adalah 6 langkah asas penyelesaian masalah dengan anak remaja anda:
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 1. Identify the problem
text: 1. Kenal pasti masalah
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 2. Think of possible solutions.
text: 2. Fikirkan jalan penyelesaian yang munasabah.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 3. Figure out what the results of each solution would be.
text: 3. Kenal pasti hasil bagi setiap penyelesaian.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 4. Choose one solution
text: 4. Pilih satu cara penyelesaian
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 5. Try it out!
text: 5. Cubalah!
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 6. Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.
text: 6. Adakah ia berkesan? Bagus! Sekiranya tidak berkesan, cuba penyelesaian lain.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: We can also teach our children the same steps.
text: Kita juga boleh mengajar anak dengan cara yang sama.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame our children. But what they really need is someone to help them work through their problems.
text: Apabila sesuatu yang buruk berlaku, kita sering marah dan menyalahkan anak-anak. Tetapi apa yang sebenarnya mereka perlukan adalah seseorang untuk membantu mereka menyelesaikan masalah.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: Take a Pause! Become aware of anger and stress. Take a deep breath or count to 10 before you react. Then respond in a calmer way.
text: Berhenti seketika! Menyedari kemarahan dan tekanan. Tarik nafas dalam-dalam atau kira hingga 10 sebelum anda memberi reaksi. Kemudian respon dengan cara yang lebih tenang.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: Try to find solutions together:
text: Cuba cari penyelesaian bersama:
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 1. Allow your teen to express how they feel and accept their feelings.
text: 1. Benarkan anak anda menyatakan perasaan mereka dan menerimanya.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 2. Try to listen to your teen and see things from their perspective.
text: 2. Cuba dengar anak remaja anda dan lihat dari perspektif mereka.
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: 3. Thank your teen for being open and trusting you
text: 3. Ucapkan terima kasih pada anak remaja anda kerana bersikap terbuka dan mempercayai anda
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Helping your teen learn how to solve problems will be something they will take with them the rest of their lives. What a gift!
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu kemahiran lagi dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Membantu remaja anda belajar bagaimana menyelesaikan masalah akan menjadi sesuatu yang akan mereka manfaatkan sepanjang hidup mereka. Ini adalah satu anugerah!
topicTitle: When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving
note: This is for topic When Children Misbehave - Part 4 Problem Solving

sourceText: Hello! Our children spend a lot of time online. Here are 6 tips to help you keep your children safe online:
text: Helo! Anak-anak kita menghabiskan banyak masa di dalam talian. Berikut adalah 6 tip untuk membantu menjaga keselamatan anak anda di dalam talian:
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: 1. Learn about risks and dangers. These include...
text: 1. Ketahui risiko dan bahaya. Ini termasuklah...
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: • Orang dewasa yang mensasarkan kanak-kanak untuk tujuan seksual di media sosial, permainan, dan platform pesanan.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography.
text: • Kandungan berbahaya – seperti keganasan, membenci wanita, membenci orang asing, menggalakkan bunuh diri dan mencederakan diri sendiri, maklumat yang salah, pornografi.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.
text: • Remaja berkongsi maklumat peribadi dan gambar atau video seks mereka sendiri.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Cyberbullying from peers and strangers.
text: • Buli siber daripada rakan sebaya dan orang asing.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: 2. Do these quick tech fixes to protect your children online:
text: 2. Lakukan pembaikan teknologi pantas ini untuk melindungi anak anda di dalam talian:
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Turn on SafeSearch on your browser to filter adult content.
text: • Hidupkan aplikasi SafeSearch (carian selamat) pada pelayar anda untuk tapis kandungan yang dikhaskan bagi orang dewasa.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Set up parental controls.
text: • Menetapkan kawalan ibu bapa.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Set up strict privacy settings on online apps and games.
text: • Menetapkan tetapan privasi yang ketat pada aplikasi dan permainan dalam talian.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Cover webcams when not in use.
text: • Tutup kamera web apabila tidak digunakan.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits:
text: 3. Bina tabiat dalam talian yang sihat dan selamat:
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Create family tech agreements with your child about healthy device use.
text: • Buat perjanjian teknologi keluarga dengan anak anda mengenai penggunaan peranti yang sihat.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Create device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
text: • Cipta ruang dan masa bebas-peranti di rumah anda (ketika makan, bermain, kerja sekolah, dan tidur).
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Help your child learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers!
text: • Bantu anak anda belajar bagaimana merahsiakan maklumat peribadi, terutamanya daripada orang yang tidak dikenali!
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Remind your children that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
text: • Ingatkan anak anda bahawa apa yang ada di dalam talian adalah kekal dalam talian (mesej, foto, dan video).
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.
text: • Mengawasi masa kanak-kanak secara aktif dalam talian, termasuk komputer, telefon pintar dan tablet.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: 4. Spend time with your child or teen online
text: 4. Luangkan masa dengan anak kecil atau anak remaja anda di dalam talian
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Get to know how your child experiences the digital world.
text: • Ketahui bagaimana pengalaman anak anda di dunia digital.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Explore websites, social media, games, and apps together.
text: • Meneroka laman sesawang, media sosial, permainan, dan aplikasi bersama dengan anak.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: • Talk to your teen on how to report things that aren't OK.
text: • Bercakap dengan anak remaja anda tentang bagaimana untuk mengadu perkara yang tidak OK.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: 5. Build open communication and trusting relationships
text: 5. Membina komunikasi terbuka dan hubungan kepercayaan
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: Tell your children that they can always talk to you if they experience something online (or anywhere) that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared.
text: Beritahu anak anda bahawa mereka sentiasa boleh bercakap dengan anda jika mereka mengalami sesuatu dalam talian (atau di mana sahaja) yang membuatkan mereka berasa sedih, tidak selesa, atau takut.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: 6. Report and seek help
text: 6. Lapor dan dapatkan bantuan
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: INHOPE Hotlines, IWF portals and the Child Helpline in your country offer support if you or your children experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.
text: Talian penting INHOPE, portal IWF dan Talian bantuan Kanak-kanak di negara anda menawarkan sokongan sekiranya anda atau anak anda mengalami keganasan dalam talian atau perkara lain yang tidak boleh diterima.
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! You have taken a BIG STEP to keeping your child safe online. Good for you!
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan! Anda telah mengambil LANGKAH BESAR untuk memastikan anak anda selamat dalam talian. Syabas!
note: This is for topic Online Child Safety

sourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing. It might make you think you are not a good parent. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Bunyi tangisan bayi boleh menjadi sangat membimbangkan. Ia mungkin membuatkan anda berfikir bahawa anda bukan ibu bapa yang baik. Tetapi semua bayi menangis. Ia adalah salah satu cara utama seorang bayi boleh memberitahu anda bahawa ada sesuatu yang tidak kena.
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: Here are some tips that might help when your baby cries:
text: Di sini ada beberapa tip yang mungkin dapat membantu apabila anak anda menangis:
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: 1. Why do babies cry?
text: 1. Mengapa bayi menangis?
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: Crying is part of your baby's development. Crying usually increases when your baby is  2-3 weeks old,  is generally highest when your baby is around 6 to 8 weeks, and often reduces around 3 to 4 months. Every baby is different!
text: Menangis adalah sebahagian daripada perkembangan bayi. Tangisan kebiasaannya meningkat apabila bayi anda berusia 2-3 minggu, secara umumnya paling kuat apabila bayi anda berusia kira-kira 6 hingga 8 minggu, dan selalunya berkurangan kira-kira 3 hingga 4 bulan. Setiap bayi adalah berbeza!
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: 2. Respond as soon as you can
text: 2. Memberi tindak balas secepat mungkin
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: Go to your baby when you hear them crying. Babies who are carried and cuddled frequently, during both fussy and contented periods, may actually cry less.
text: Pergi kepada bayi anda apabila anda mendengar mereka menangis. Bayi yang kerap didukung dan dipeluk, ketika mereka merengek dan gembira, akan kurang menangis.
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: 3.  Check to see why your baby is crying
text: 3. Periksa mengapa bayi anda menangis
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: It might be hunger, pain, too much going on, rough handling, feeling cold/hot, wanting contact or attention, or feeling irritable. Babies can cry when they sense tension in the room, or sometimes for no reason at all!
text: Mungkin lapar, sakit, terlalu banyak perkara berlaku, pengendalian yang kasar, berasa sejuk/panas, inginkan sentuhan atau perhatian, atau meragam. Bayi boleh menangis apabila mereka merasakan ketegangan di dalam bilik, atau kadang kala menangis tanpa sebarang sebab!
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: 4. Comfort your baby
text: 4. Tenangkan bayi anda
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: Try swaddling, gently rocking, or singing softly. You might need to feed your baby, change their diaper, make them feel warmer or cooler or just hold them
text: Cuba bedung, buai dengan perlahan, atau menyanyi dengan perlahan. Anda mungkin perlu memberi bayi anda makan, menukarkan lampinnya, buat mereka berasa hangat atau sejuk atau hanya memegang mereka
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: 5. Take a break!
text: 5. Berehat seketika!
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: Take a Pause and try to relax. If you are getting angry because your baby won’t stop crying, you can leave them on their back in a safe place for a bit. Check on your baby every 5-10 minutes.
text: Berhenti seketika dan cuba untuk bertenang. Jika anda berasa marah kerana bayi anda tidak berhenti menangis, anda boleh meninggalkannya secara terlentang di tempat yang selamat buat seketika. Periksa bayi anda setiap 5-10 minit.
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: If you feel overwhelmed, ask someone for help - that is a sign of strength.
text: Jika anda berasa bingung, minta bantuan seseorang - itu adalah tanda kekuatan.
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: 6. Be gentle and patient with yourself
text: 6. Berlembut dan sabar dengan diri sendiri
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: You are not a bad parent if your baby continues to cry. You are doing your best!
text: Anda bukanlah ibu bapa yang teruk jika bayi anda terus menangis. Anda telah melakukan yang terbaik!
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: 7. If you think your baby is injured or sick, call or visit a clinic
text: 7. Jika anda fikir bayi anda cedera atau sakit, hubungi atau pergi ke klinik
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: If your baby cries non-stop for a long time, seek medical help immediately.
text: Jika bayi anda menangis tanpa henti dalam tempoh masa yang panjang, dapatkan bantuan perubatan dengan segera.
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. We are all learning here!
text: Tahniah! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Di sini kita semua sedang belajar!
note: This is for topic Crying

sourceText: Hi! Today's Tip is about how we can help our children learn how to cope with their emotions:
text: Hai! Tip hari ini adalah mengenai bagaimana kita boleh membantu anak-anak kita belajar bagaimana untuk menangani emosi mereka:
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: 1. Be open to your child
text: 1. Bersikap terbuka dengan anak anda
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: Your child will look to you for support and reassurance. Listen to your children when they share, accept how they feel, and give them comfort.
text: Anak anda akan mengharapkan sokongan dan kata-kata yang menenangkan daripada anda. Dengar apabila anak-anak anda berkongsi, terima bagaimana perasaan mereka, dan tenangkan mereka.
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: 2. Share your own feelings
text: 2. Kongsi perasaan anda
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: This will help your children recognise, understand and manage their own feelings too.
text: Ini juga akan membantu anak-anak anda mengenal, memahami dan mengurus emosi mereka sendiri.
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: 3. Help your child learn how to talk about feelings
text: 3. Bantu anak anda belajar bagaimana untuk bercakap tentang perasaan
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. Even babies can feel and express these emotions. As children get older, they learn to identify many other emotions, like excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
text: Terdapat 6 emosi asas: Gembira, Sedih, Marah, Jijik, Terkejut, dan Takut. Malah bayi juga boleh merasai dan meluahkan emosi ini. Apabila kanak-kanak membesar, mereka belajar untuk mengenalpasti banyak emosi lain, seperti teruja, kecewa, bangga, kesunyian, tenang, rasa bersalah, atau keliru.
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: 4. Talking about difficult emotions
text: 4. Bercakap tentang emosi sukar
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: It is difficult for many people to talk about and express emotions and feelings. Especially for boys and men who were told not to cry when sad or laugh when happy. .
text: Sukar bagi kebanyakan orang untuk bercakap dan meluahkan emosi dan perasaan. Terutamanya bagi kanak-kanak lelaki dan lelaki dewasa yang diberitahu untuk tidak menangis apabila sedih atau ketawa bila gembira.
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: But we all have feelings and emotions. We can learn how to become aware of them, experience them in our body, and communicate about them. This can help children manage anger, disappointment, and frustration.
text: Tetapi kita semua mempunyai perasaan dan emosi. Kita boleh belajar bagaimana untuk menyedarinya, merasainya dalam tubuh kita, dan berkomunikasi tentangnya. Ini boleh membantu kanak-kanak mengendali kemarahan, kehampaan, dan kekecewaan.
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: 5. Notice the positive emotions
text: 5. Perhatikan emosi positif
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: Talking about feelings can also help your child be more aware of positive emotions (such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness), and appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
text: Bercakap mengenai perasaan boleh juga membantu anak anda lebih sedar tentang emosi positif (seperti rasa kedamaian, kegembiraan, atau ketenangan), dan menghargai saat-saat indah atau perasaan sayang!
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: 6. Show your child that you care
text: 6. Tunjukkan kepada anak anda bahawa anda mengambil berat
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: Use physical and verbal support to make your child feel accepted and loved. A hug or saying, "I understand," can mean a lot. Remind your child that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.
text: Gunakan sokongan fizikal dan lisan untuk membuatkan anak anda berasa diterima dan disayangi. Pelukan atau menyatakan, "Ibu / bapa faham," boleh memberi banyak makna. Ingatkan anak anda bahawa anda ada untuknya dan mereka boleh sentiasa bercakap dengan anda.
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Remember that all emotions are okay. It's how we respond to them that is important!
text: Tahniah! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Ingat bahawa semua emosi adalah okey. Bagaimana kita memberi tindak balas kepada mereka itulah yang penting!
note: This is for topic Emotional Support

sourceText: Hi! Every child has challenging behaviour sometimes. If you would like some tips, type 'Help'.
text: Hai! Setiap anak kadangkala mempunyai tingkah laku yang mencabar. Jika anda memerlukan sebarang tip, taip 'Tolong'.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can support our teens when they experience really difficult situations.
text: Tip Hari Ini adalah mengenai bagaimana kita boleh menyokong anak remaja kita apabila mereka mengalami situasi yang sangat sukar.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: When our children share difficult experiences with us, we may initially get angry because we are afraid for them. But that is when we need to stay calm, listen, and be open.
text: Apabila anak kita berkongsi pengalaman sukarnya dengan kita, pada mulanya kita mungkin akan berasa marah kerana kita bimbangkan mereka. Tetapi ketika itulah kita perlu kekal tenang, mendengar, dan bersikap terbuka.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: Here are some things you can do when your teen shares something difficult with you:
text: Di sini adalah beberapa tip yang boleh anda lakukan apabila anak remaja anda berkongsi sesuatu yang sukar dengan anda:
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: 1. Take a deep breath before you respond.
text: 1. Tarikh nafas dalam-dalam sebelum memberi tindak balas.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: 2. Listen to what your child is saying. Notice how they are feeling.
text: 2. Dengar apa yang anak anda katakan. Perhatikan bagaimana perasaan mereka.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: 3. Notice how you feel. Ask yourself, "What does my child need right now?"
text: 3. Perhatikan bagaimana perasaan anda. Tanya diri anda, "Apakah yang anak saya perlukan sekarang?"
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: 4. Reassure your child that you are there for them.
text: 4. Yakinkan anak anda bahawa anda ada untuk mereka.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: 5. You can deal with the consequences later but right now your child needs you.
text: 5. Anda boleh menangani akibatnya kemudian tetapi sekarang anak anda memerlukan anda.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: 6. Discuss possible solutions or next steps to take action.
text: 6. Bincang penyelesaian yang munasabah atau langkah seterusnya untuk bertindak.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: 7. Remind your child again that you love them and thank them for sharing with you.
text: 7. Ingatkan anak anda sekali lagi bahawa anda menyayangi mereka dan berterima kasih kepada mereka kerana berkongsi dengan anda.
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! We understand that this can be really difficult. Supporting your child through a crisis will also teach them how to support others in difficult times. Good for you!
text: Tahniah! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Kami faham bahawa ini memang sangat sukar. Menyokong anak anda menangani krisis juga akan mengajar mereka bagaimana untuk menyokong orang lain dalam keadaan yang sukar. Syabas!
note: This is for topic Crisis Support

sourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can help to protect our children.
text: Tip Hari Ini adalah mengenai bagaimana kita boleh membantu melindungi anak-anak kita.
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: The idea of talking to children about abuse can be scary. We don't know what to say. But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and that they can tell you if something ever happens.
text: Untuk bercakap dengan anak-anak mengenai penderaan adalah sesuatu yang menakutkan. Kita tidak tahu apa yang ingin dikatakan. Tetapi terdapat beberapa perkara yang boleh membantu mereka memahami bilakah tidak OK untuk disentuh, dan mereka boleh memberitahu anda jika sesuatu berlaku.
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: Here are 3 things that you should make sure your child knows to protect them from abuse:
text: Di sini adalah 3 perkara yang anda perlu pastikan anak anda tahu untuk melindungi mereka daripada penderaan:
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: 1. Learn about private parts
text: 1. Belajar mengenai bahagian sulit
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: The parts of their body that go under people's underwear or a swimsuit are private parts. It is not OK for other people to touch or to ask to look at them, or ask them to look at or touch theirs.
text: Bahagian badan yang berada di bawah seluar dalam atau baju renang adalah bahagian sulit. Adalah tidak OK untuk orang lain menyentuhnya atau meminta untuk melihatnya, atau meminta mereka untuk melihat atau menyentuh bahagian sulit mereka.
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: 2. Your body belongs to you
text: 2. Badan anda adalah milik anda
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: If someone tries to touch your children's private parts they must say NO and tell a grown up that they trust.
text: Jika seseorang cuba untuk menyentuh bahagian sulit anak-anak anda mereka perlu berkata TIDAK dan memberitahu orang dewasa yang mereka percayai.
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: 3. Bad secrets should be told.
text: 3. Rahsia buruk perlu diberitahu.
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: Your children should tell you if there is a secret that makes them feel worried. You will not be angry. Only nice secrets - like a surprise birthday party - should be kept secret.
text: Anak-anak anda perlu memberitahu anda jika terdapat rahsia yang membuat mereka berasa risau. Anda tidak akan marah. Hanya rahsia yang baik - seperti kejutan parti hari jadi - perlu dirahsiakan.
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: We understand that this can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance.
text: Kami faham bahawa ini boleh menjadi sangat sukar. Sila taip "Tolong" jika anda mahukan sebarang sokongan atau bimbingan tambahan.
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Supporting your child through a crisis will also teach them how to support others in difficult times. Good for you!
text: Tahniah! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Menyokong anak anda melalui krisis juga akan mengajar mereka bagaimana untuk menyokong orang lain dalam keadaan yang sukar. Syabas!
note: This is for topic GoodBad Touch

sourceText: Today's tip is about how we can support positive family relationships at home.
text: Tip hari ini ialah tentang bagaimana kita boleh menyokong hubungan kekeluargaan yang positif di rumah.
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Here are 6 simple steps for more family harmony at home:
text: Terdapat 6 langkah mudah untuk keluarga yang lebih harmoni di rumah:
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: 1. Be a model of behaviour for your children
text: 1. Cuba menjadi model tingkah laku untuk anak anda
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: How we talk and behave in front of our children is a big influence on how they behave too! The more we practice modeling peaceful, loving relationships for our children, the more secure and loved they will feel.
