text: Bagaimana kita bercakap dan berkelakuan di hadapan anak-anak sangat mempengaruhi bagaimana mereka berkelakuan juga! Lebih banyak kita mengamalkan model hubungan yang harmoni dan penuh kasih sayang terhadap anak-anak, mereka akan rasa lebih selamat dan disayangi.
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: 2. Use positive language. It works!
text: 2. Gunakan bahasa yang positif. Ia berkesan!
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don’t want them to do: Instead of “Stop shouting,” try “Please speak more quietly”
text: Beritahu orang lain apa yang anda ingin mereka lakukan bukannya apa yang anda tidak mahu mereka lakukan: Daripada "Berhenti menjerit," cuba "Tolong bercakap dengan perlahan"
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Praise others to make them feel appreciated. Saying “Thank you for clearing the dinner” can make a big difference.
text: Puji orang lain supaya mereka rasa lebih dihargai. Ucapkan "Terima kasih kerana mengemas selepas makan malam" boleh memberi perbezaan yang besar.
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: 3. Be a great listener
text: 3. Jadilah pendengar yang baik
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Listen to others when they are talking with you. Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying. It can help to summarise what you have heard before responding: “What I hear you saying is…”
text: Beri perhatian apabila mereka sedang bercakap dengan anda. Bersikap terbuka dan tunjukkan bahawa anda sedang mendengar apa yang mereka katakan. Ini akan membantu anda merumuskan apa yang telah anda dengar sebelum memberikan respon: "Apa yang saya dengar anda katakan ialah..."
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: 4. Share the load
text: 4. Berkongsi beban
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared. Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members
text: Menjaga anak-anak dan ahli keluarga lain adalah sukar, tetapi ia lebih mudah apabila tanggungjawab dikongsi bersama. Cuba kongsi kerja rumah, penjagaan anak, dan lain-lain tugas secara adil dalam kalangan ahli keluarga
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: 5. Take care of yourself
text: 5. Jaga diri sendiri
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household. It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed.
text: Wujudkan jadual waktu "bertugas" dan waktu "berehat" bersama dengan orang dewasa lain dalam rumah anda. Tidak mengapa untuk meminta tolong apabila anda berasa letih atau stres.
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: When you see arguments building up, agree to take a break and go into another room or outside if you can.
text: Apabila anda nampak pertelingkahan semakin bertambah, cuba berehat dan masuk ke bilik lain atau keluar jika boleh.
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: 6. Do nice things together as a family
text: 6. Lakukan perkara yang menyeronokkan bersama sebagai sebuah keluarga
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Let each family member take turns choosing a whole family activity. Find ways to spend time alone with other adults in your home, too!
text: Berikan peluang kepada setiap ahli keluarga bergilir memilih aktiviti keluarga secara bersama. Cari jalan untuk meluangkan masa bersendirian dengan orang dewasa lain dalam rumah anda, juga!
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit!  Every time you resolve conflicts in a peaceful way, you increase your child's brain development. Be proud of yourself when you do it!
text: Tahniah kerana menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Setiap kali anda menyelesaikan konflik secara tenang, anda telah meningkatkan perkembangan otak anak anda. Berbanggalah dengan diri anda apabila anda melakukannya!
note: This is for topic Family Harmony

sourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet, which can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. When you make a family budget, you agree on how to spend and save money together. This can help you have enough at the end of the month (so you need to borrow less) and help children understand that we all need to make hard decisions.
text: Berjuta keluarga sedang bergelut memenuhi keperluan, yang mana boleh membuatkan kita berasa bimbang, stres, dan sedih. Apabila anda membuat bajet keluarga, anda bersetuju tentang bagaimana berbelanja dan menyimpan wang secara bersama. Ini akan membantu mencukupkan keperluan anda pada hujung bulan (jadi anda akan kurang meminjam) dan membantu anak-anak untuk memahami bahawa kita semua perlu membuat keputusan yang sukar.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: Here are 4 quick steps to make a budget and save money together as a family:
text: Ini adalah 4 langkah pantas untuk menyediakan bajet dan menyimpan wang bersama sebagai sebuah keluarga:
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: 1. What do we spend on now?
text: 1. Apa yang kita berbelanja sekarang?
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • Get a piece of paper or cardboard and a pen.
text: • Dapatkan sekeping kertas atau kadbod dan sebatang pen.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
text: • Lukis gambar semua benda atau perkara yang anda dan keluarga beli setiap bulan.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • Write next to each picture how much each thing costs.
text: • Tulis harga setiap barang di sebelah gambar tersebut.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text: • Jumlahkan berapakah yang anda perlu belanjakan setiap bulan.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: 2. Talk about needs and wants
text: 2. Bercakap tentang keperluan dan kehendak
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • Needs: Which things are important or must haves for your family to survive? (like food, soap to wash hands, needs for ill or disabled family members).
text: • Keperluan: Apakah benda atau perkara penting atau mustahak untuk keluarga anda meneruskan hidup? (seperti makanan, sabun untuk basuh tangan, keperluan ahli keluarga yang sakit atau kurang upaya).
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • Wants: Which things are nice to have but not essential?
text: • Kehendak: Apakah benda atau perkara yang elok untuk dimiliki tetapi bukan perkara mustahak?
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: Discuss with your children where you can spend less as a family.
text: Bincangkan dengan anak anda di mana anda boleh berbelanja dengan lebih jimat sebagai sebuah keluarga.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: 3. Build your own budget
text: 3. Bina bajet anda sendiri
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • Find some stones or small objects. This is your money for the month.
text: • Cari beberapa biji batu atau objek kecil. Ini adalah duit anda untuk bulan ini.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • As a family, decide what you will spend on what, and put the stones on your picture.
text: • Sebagai sebuah keluarga, buat keputusan apa yang perlu dibeli, dan letakkan batu tersebut atas gambar anda.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: • If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or an emergency  – it can make a big difference over time.
text: • Jika anda boleh menyimpan walaupun sejumlah yang kecil untuk masa depan atau masa kecemasan – ia akan memberikan perbezaan yang besar dari semasa ke semasa.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: 4. Find out where you can get extra help
text: 4. Carilah di mana anda boleh dapatkan bantuan tambahan
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: Your government or community groups may be giving money, or food parcels to families during COVID-19.
text: Kerajaan atau kumpulan komuniti anda mungkin memberi wang, atau bungkusan makanan kepada keluarga semasa COVID-19.
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Learning ways to manage money as a family has reduced arguments and stress for millions of families. That's real success!
text: Syabas kerana menambah satu lagi kemahiran ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Belajar cara menguruskan wang sebagai sebuah keluarga dapat mengurangkan perselisihan dan stres kepada berjuta keluarga. Itu adalah kejayaan sebenar!
note: This is for topic Family Budgeting

sourceText: Hello! This is a stressful time, especially for parents. When we are stressed or angry, we do not make the best decisions. Taking the time to care for ourselves will help us care for our children.
text: Helo! Ini adalah masa yang sangat mendatangkan stres, terutama kepada ibu bapa. Apabila kita stres atau marah, kita tidak dapat membuat keputusan yang baik. Mengambil masa untuk menjaga diri kita akan membantu kita untuk menjaga anak-anak.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Today's tip is about how to keep calm and manage stress in our busy lives.
text: Tip hari ini adalah tentang bagaimana untuk bertenang dan menguruskan stres dalam kesibukan hidup kita.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Taking a Pause is a simple relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried. It can also be helpful when you find your child is irritating you or has done something wrong.
text: Berhenti Seketika adalah aktiviti santai mudah yang boleh anda lakukan apabila berasa stres atau bimbang. Ia juga membantu apabila anak anda menjengkelkan atau telah melakukan kesalahan.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Step 1. Close your eyes and take a deep breath.
text: Langkah 1. Tutup mata anda dan tarik nafas panjang.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Step 2. Ask yourself, "What am I thinking?" Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative.
text: Langkah 2. Tanya diri anda, "Apa yang sedang saya fikirkan?" Perhatikan sama ada fikiran anda positif atau negatif.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Notice how you are feeling emotionally. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Remind yourself that whatever you feel, it is okay.
text: Perhatikan bagaimana perasaan anda. Perhatikan sama ada anda rasa seronok atau tidak seronok. Ingatkan diri anda apa jua perasaan anda, ia adalah okey.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.
text: Perhatikan apa yang anda rasa pada badan anda. Perhatikan jika ada bahagian yang sakit atau tegang.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Step 3. Focus on your breath. Feel your breath as it goes in and out. You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath. Do this for about 10 breaths.
text: Langkah 3: Fokus kepada pernafasan anda. Rasa nafas anda masuk dan keluar. Anda boleh letak satu tangan di atas perut dan rasa ia naik dan turun setiap kali bernafas. Lakukannya sebanyak 10 kali pernafasan.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Step 4. Expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room.
text: Langkah 4: Luaskan kesedaran anda ke seluruh badan. Dengar bunyi-bunyian di dalam bilik.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Step 5. Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. When you are ready, open your eyes.
text: Langkah 5: Luangkan masa untuk refleksi sama ada anda rasa berbeza. Apabila anda telah bersedia, buka mata anda.
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Well done for Taking a Pause. You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit!
text: Syabas kerana Berhenti Seketika. Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran ke dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda!
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: You can do this anytime you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also Take a Pause with your Children!
text: Anda boleh melakukannya bila-bila masa anda berasa stres. Ia memberi anda peluang untuk rasa lebih tenang. Walaupun hanya dengan beberapa kali menarik nafas panjang atau berhubung dengan bumi yang anda pijak boleh memberikan perbezaan. Anda juga boleh Berhenti Seketika dengan Anak anda!
topicTitle: Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause
note: This is for topic Keep Calm and Manage Stress including Take a Pause

sourceText: Hi! How are you feeling right now? Have you only got 30 seconds? Let's take a quick pause together. It might be helpful.
text: Hai! Apa perasaan anda sekarang? Adakah anda mempunyai masa 30 saat? Jom berhenti seketika bersama-sama. Ini mungkin akan membantu.
note: This is for topic Short Pause

sourceText: Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. When you are ready, open your eyes again. Everything is okay.
text: Duduk, tutup mata anda dan dengar nafas anda masuk dan keluar. Perhatikan apa yang anda rasa. Apabila telah bersedia, buka mata anda sekali lagi. Semuanya okey sahaja.
note: This is for topic Short Pause

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda.
note: This is for topic Short Pause

sourceText: Hello! How are you feeling? If you are feeling overwhelmed or stressed, here is a short activity that can help when you are feeling like needing some more support to get through the day.
text: Helo! Apa perasaan anda? Jika anda berasa gelisah atau stres, di sini ada aktiviti pendek yang boleh membantu apabila anda berasa seperti memerlukan beberapa sokongan untuk meneruskan hari ini.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Kenal pasti apa yang sedang berlaku kepada anda pada masa ini. Apa yang anda sedang fikir? Adakah fikiran anda positif atau negatif. Bagaimana perasaan anda? Adakah anda rasa seronok atau tidak seronok? Apa yang badan anda rasa? Adakah anda rasa tegang atau santai?
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: Sit comfortably and close your eyes. Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. You can then say the following words silently to yourself:
text: Duduk dengan selesa dan tutup mata anda. Hubungkan dengan hati anda secara baik dan lembut. Anda mungkin mahu meletakkan satu tangan pada hati atau dada anda. Kemudian anda sebutkan perkataan berikut kepada diri anda secara senyap:
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: May I be peaceful.
text: Semoga saya tenang.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: May I be safe.
text: Semoga saya selamat.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: May I be healthy.
text: Semoga saya sihat.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: May I be happy.
text: Semoga saya gembira.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: May there be love in my family.
text: Semoga wujud kasih sayang dalam keluarga saya.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: May I feel loved.
text: Semoga saya rasa disayangi.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: Before you open your eyes, take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text: Sebelum anda membuka mata, ambil masa seketika untuk refleksi pengalaman anda. Perhatikan jika anda rasa sebarang perbezaan.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda.
note: This is for topic Loving Kindness

sourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Helo! Adakah anda tahu bahawa nombor 3 adalah nombor ajaib? Tarik nafas dengan kiraan tiga dan hembus nafas dengan kiraan tiga. Bagaimana perasaan anda sekarang? Adakah anda rasa sebarang perbezaan?
note: This is for topic Magical Number

sourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now? Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now? What are three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Apakah tiga makanan kegemaran anda? Bolehkah anda namakan tiga benda yang anda nampak sekarang? Adakah anda boleh mendengar tiga bunyi sekarang? Apakah tiga perkara yang anda syukuri sekarang?
note: This is for topic Magical Number

sourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Three is a magical number!
text: Tarik nafas ke dalam dengan kiraan tiga dan tarik nafas keluar dengan kiraan tiga. Bagaimana anda rasa sekarang? Adakah anda rasa sebarang perbezaan? Tiga adalah nombor yang magik!
note: This is for topic Magical Number

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda.
note: This is for topic Magical Number

sourceText: Hello! We love our children and teenagers, but stress from caregiving, money, and COVID-19 can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.
text: Helo! Kita sayang kanak-kanak dan remaja, tetapi tekanan dari penjagaan, duit, dan COVID-19 menyebabkan kita marah. Di sini adalah bagaimana kita boleh kekal mengawal diri dan sentiasa tenang.
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: Stop the river at the source. The same things usually make us get stressed and angry every time. What makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?
text: Berhentikan masalah daripada punca. Perkara yang sama selalunya membuat kita tertekan dan marah. Apa yang menyebabkan anda marah? Bila ianya berlaku? Bagaimana anda bertindak balas?
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text: Cegah rasa marah daripada awal. Dapatkan tidur dan rehat apabila anda letih. Cuba untuk makan sesuatu apabila anda lapar. Minta bantuan daripada seseorang apabila anda merasa sunyi.
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: Here are some things that can help make it less likely that bad things happen when you are angry:
text: Berikut adalah sesuatu yang boleh membantu anda mengelakkan perkara buruk terjadi apabila anda sedang marah:
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: 1. Cut back on drinking alcohol or don’t drink, especially when the kids are awake.
text: 1. Bagi mereka yang tiada larangan meminum alkohol, kurangkan minum atau jangan minum alkohol, terutama apabila anak-anak sedang berjaga.
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: 2. Do you have weapons or things  that can be used to hurt others?  Lock them up, hide them or take them out of the home.
text: 2. Adakah anda mempunyai senjata atau sesuatu yang boleh digunakan untuk mencederakan orang lain? Kunci, sembunyi atau keluarkan dari rumah.
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: 3. It’s ok to have your children stay somewhere safe or take them to a place where they can get help.
text: 3. Adalah okey untuk membenarkan kanak-kanak tinggal di satu tempat dengan selamat atau membawa mereka ke satu tempat yang mana mereka boleh mendapat bantuan.
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Learning how to manage your anger can help you  avoid some difficult situations.
text: Bagus! Anda telah menambah kemahiran lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda. Belajar bagaimana untuk menguruskan kemarahan boleh membantu anda mengelakkan situasi yang sukar.
note: This is for topic When we are angry

sourceText: Hi! Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.
text: Hai! Mengurus kemarahan boleh menjadi sukar. Berhenti sebentar apabila anda rasa sedang marah terhadap anak-anak atau orang lain.
note: This is for topic Anger Management

sourceText: Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text: Pergi ke tempat lain selama 5 minit bagi mengawal kembali emosi anda. Jika anda mempunyai ruang luar yang selamat, pergilah keluar. Anda dapat mengatasinya!
note: This is for topic Anger Management

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda.
note: This is for topic Anger Management

sourceText: Hello! Here's a fun physical activity that can help release stress and keep healthy.
text: Helo! Di sini ada aktiviti fizikal yang seronok dan dapat membantu anda mengurangkan stres dan kekal sihat.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Berdiri tegak dan regangkan lengan anda sehingga ke atas awan. Tolak sebarang awan dan biarkan matahari menyinari anda. Regang ke arah kiri dan kanan. Regang ke depan dan ke belakang.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Let your hand hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
text: Biarkan tangan anda tergantung sebelah menyebelah. Pusingkan bahu anda dengan ketat sehingga menyentuh telinga selama anda menarik nafas, gerakkan mata anda, dan tahan nafas. Lepaskan bahu anda apabila anda merehatkan badan.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Relax your arms and let your arms swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Rehatkan lengan anda dan biarkan lengan berpusing atas ke bawah, dan tukar bahagian atas badan. Lengan anda patut menyentuh bahagian belakang apabila anda memusing dari sebelah ke sebelah yang lain.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Letakkan satu kaki di hadapan sebelah kaki dan buat bulatan kecil daripada buku lali, ingat untuk mengubah kedua-dua belah. Lakukan untuk setiap kaki dengan empat kali bagi setiap arah.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Sekarang goyang keseluruhan badan anda selaju yang boleh. Goyang setinggi yang boleh! Goyang ke bawah perlahan! Goyang dan pusing!
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.
text: Tutup mata anda dan naikkan lengan anda perlahan-lahan ke atas kepala sambil tarik nafas. Turunkan lengan anda perlahan-lahan sambil hembuskan nafas keluar.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience.
text: Ambil masa sebentar untuk refleksi pengalaman anda.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit.
text: Syabas! Anda telah menambah satu lagi kemahiran dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: Physical exercise is a great way to reduce stress and keep healthy. You can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text: Latihan fizikal adalah kaedah yang bagus untuk mengurangkan stres dan kekal sihat. Anda boleh melakukan aktiviti ini pada bila-bila masa yang anda rasa perlu untuk mengurangkan stres dan mengembalikan tenaga badan dan minda.
note: This is for topic Exercise

sourceText: We are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps reduce the impact of COVID-19 and encourages us to continue with our lives…but it also presents risks and dangers.
text: Kita sedang menghabiskan banyak masa secara dalam talian. Saling berhubung membantu mengurangkan kesan COVID-19 dan menggalakkan kita untuk meneruskan kehidupan...tetapi ia juga mempunyai risiko dan bahaya.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: Here are 5 tips that can help you keep yourself safe online:
text: Berikut adalah 5 tip yang boleh membantu anda untuk kekal selamat dalam talian:
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: 1. Learn about risks and dangers
text: 1. Belajar tentang risiko dan bahaya
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Adults targeting people for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: • Orang dewasa mencari seseorang untuk tujuan seksual dalam media sosial, perjudian, dan platform pesanan.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography
text: • Kandungan yang mendatangkan keburukan - seperti keganasan, membenci wanita, membenci orang asing, menggalakkan membunuh diri dan mencederakan diri sendiri,  maklumat yang salah, pornografi
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos.
text: • Berkongsi maklumat peribadi dan foto atau video seksual.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Cyberbullying from other people and strangers.
text: • Buli siber daripada orang lain dan tidak dikenali.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: 2. Here are some quick tech fixes to reduce risks:
text: 2. Berikut terdapat beberapa teknologi yang cepat untuk mengurangkan risiko:
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Turn on SafeSearch on your browser to filter adult content.
text: • Hidupkan aplikasi SafeSearch (carian selamat) pada pelayar anda untuk tapis kandungan yang dikhaskan bagi orang dewasa.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Set up parental controls.
text: • Menetapkan kawalan ibu bapa.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Set up strict privacy settings on online apps and games.
text: • Menetapkan tetapan privasi yang ketat pada aplikasi dan permainan dalam talian.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: • Cover webcams when not in use.
text: • Tutup kamera web apabila tidak digunakan.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits:
text: 3. Bina tabiat dalam talian yang sihat dan selamat:
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: You can also create healthy and safe online habits like creating device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
text: Anda boleh juga mencipta tabiat dalam talian yang sihat dan selamat seperti mencipta ruang peranti kosong dan masa dalam rumah anda (makan, bermain, kerja sekolah, dan tidur).
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: 4. Maintain privacy
text: 4. Kekalkan privasi
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: Keep personal information private, especially from strangers. – some people are not who they say they are! Remember that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
text: Jaga maklumat peribadi yang sulit, terutama daripada orang tidak dikenali. - sesetengah orang bukanlah orang yang mereka nyatakan siapa mereka! Ingat apa yang ada dalam talian kekal dalam talian (mesej, foto, dan video).
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: 5. Report and seek help
text: 5. Laporkan dan minta bantuan
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: Report to INHOPE Hotlines and IWF portals to get support if you experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.
text: Lapor kepada Talian Hotline INHOPE dan Portal IWF untuk mendapatkan bantuan jika anda mengalami keganasan dalam talian atau perkara lain yang tidak boleh diterima.
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Digital parenting is just like parenting in the real world. You have taken a BIG STEP to keeping you and your children safe online. Good for you!
text: Bagus! Anda telah menambah kemahiran lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan! Keibubapaan Digital adalah seperti keibubapaan dalam dunia sebenar. Anda telah mengambil LANGKAH BESAR untuk mengekalkan anda dan anak-anak selamat dalam talian. Syabas!
note: This is for topic Online Safety

sourceText: When your children ask you about COVID-19, be willing to talk. They will already have heard something. Silence and secrets do not protect our children. Honesty and openness do. Think about how much they will understand. You know them best.
text: Apabila anak-anak anda bertanya mengenai COVID-19, bersedia untuk bercakap. Mereka mungkin telah mendengar sesuatu. Berdiam diri dan berahsia tidak melindungi anak-anak kita. Jujur dan terbuka boleh membantu. Fikirkan tentang berapa banyak mereka akan faham. Anda lebih tahu tentang mereka.
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Here are 4 simple steps that you can do when talking about COVID-19 with your children:
text: Berikut ada 4 langkah mudah yang anda boleh lakukan apabila bercakap mengenai COVID-19 dengan anak-anak anda:
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Step 1. Be open, honest, and supportive
text: Langkah 1. Bersikap terbuka, jujur dan menyokong
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Allow your child to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.
text: Benarkan anak anda bercakap secara terbuka. Tanya mereka soalan terbuka dan kenal pasti sejauh mana mereka telah mengetahuinya.
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old your child is and how much they can understand.
text: Selalulah menjawab soalan mereka dengan betul. Fikir mengenai usia anak anda dan berapa banyak mereka boleh faham.
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Your child may be scared or confused. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.
text: Anak anda mungkin berasa takut atau keliru. Berikan mereka ruang untuk berkongsi bagaimana perasaan dan biarkan mereka tahu bahawa anda ada untuk mereka.
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Step 2. It is OK not to know the answers.
text: Langkah 2. Adalah okey untuk tidak tahu jawapan.
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”  Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with your child. The WHO and UNICEF websites are great first steps to learn
text: Tidak mengapa untuk bercakap "Kami tidak tahu, tetapi kami sedang usahakan; atau kami tidak tahu, 'tetapi kami fikir'." Gunakan peluang ini untuk mempelajari sesuatu yang baharu dengan anak anda. Laman web WHO dan UNICEF adalah langkah yang terbaik untuk belajar
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Step 3. Be a hero not a bully
text: Langkah 3. Jadilah wira dan bukan pembuli
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do with the way someone looks, where they are from, or what language they speak.
text: Terangkan bahawa COVID-19 tidak ada kaitan dengan rupa paras seseorang, asal-usul mereka, atau bahasa yang mereka tuturkan.
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Tell your child that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.
text: Beritahu anak anda bahawa kita perlu bertimbang rasa kepada orang yang sakit dan orang yang menjaga mereka.
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Step 4. End on a good note
text: Langkah 4. Berhenti dengan nota yang baik
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Check to see if your child is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
text: Semak untuk melihat sama ada anak anda okey. Ingatkan mereka bahawa anda mengambil berat dan mereka boleh bercakap dengan anda pada bila-bila masa. Kemudian lakukan sesuatu yang seronok bersama-sama!
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! When you talk about COVID-19 with your child in a supportive way, you make them feel loved and safe. You are the hero of this story!
text: Syabas kerana telah menambah maklumat lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Apabila anda bercakap mengenai COVID-19 dengan anak anda dengan cara yang menyokong, anda akan membuat mereka rasa disayangi dan selamat. Anda adalah hero untuk cerita ini!
note: This is for topic Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: All children, including those living with disabilities, need love, respect and time especially at difficult times.
text: Semua kanak-kanak, termasuk yang kurang upaya, perlukan kasih sayang, penghormatan dan masa terutama dalam masa yang sukar.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: Here are 6 simple tips that you can do to support children living with disabilities:
text: Berikut adalah 6 tip mudah yang anda boleh lakukan untuk membantu kanak-kanak kurang upaya:
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: 1. Keep your child safe and well
text: 1. Pastikan anak anda selamat dan sejahtera
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Keep your country's COVID-19 rules, and help your child to be active - do whatever exercise you can with them inside or outside your home
text: • Hormati peraturan negara anda mengenai COVID-19, dan bantu anak anda untuk aktif - lakukan apa sahaja senaman dengan mereka di dalam atau di luar rumah anda
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Keep emergency contact numbers somewhere easy to see
text: • Simpan nombor hubungan kecemasan yang mudah untuk dilihat
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: 2. Try to understand how they are feeling
text: 2. Cuba untuk memahami bagaimana perasaan mereka
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Your child may be feeling stressed, anxious, and frustrated.
text: • Anak anda mungkin berasa tertekan, risau, dan kecewa.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Tell them you love them
text: • Beritahu bahawa anda sayang mereka
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: 3. Talk and communicate with your child
text: 3. Bercakap dan berkomunikasi dengan anak anda
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Get down to your child’s level when you speak.
text: • Bercakap sama paras dengan anak anda.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Look at them and smile
text: • Lihat mereka dan senyum
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Give them time to tell you or show you what they think
text: • Beri mereka masa untuk memberitahu atau menunjukkan kepada anda apa yang mereka fikir
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Tell your child that you understand
text: • Beritahu anak anda bahawa anda memahami
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: 4. Praise them!
text: 4. Puji mereka!
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Praise them for behaving well, and for trying.
text: Puji mereka kerana berkelakuan baik, dan kerana mencuba.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Focus on what they can do, not what they can't.
text: Fokus kepada apa yang mereka boleh buat, dan bukan apa yang mereka tidak boleh buat.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Only help children when they need it. This helps to build independence!
text: Hanya bantu anak-anak ketika mereka memerlukannya. Ini membantu mereka membina sifat berdikari!
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: 5. Make a daily plan
text: 5. Membuat perancangan harian
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Having things that are the same each day helps children feel secure and safe.
text: • Mempunyai perkara yang sama setiap hari membantu kanak-kanak merasa terjamin dan selamat.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Include some things they like to do.
text: • Libatkan beberapa perkara yang mereka suka lakukan.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Give your child choices: this gives them a sense of control and builds self-esteem.
text: • Beri anak anda pilihan: ini memberi mereka rasa keupayaan mengawal keadaan dan membina estim diri.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Use simple language and clear instructions. If words don’t work, try gestures and pictures.
text: • Gunakan bahasa yang mudah dan arahan yang jelas. Sekiranya perkataan tidak berfungsi, cuba gunakan pergerakan dan gambar.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: 6. Ask for help
text: 6. Minta bantuan
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Share the load with other adult family members.
text: • Berkongsi beban dengan ahli keluarga dewasa yang lain.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: •  You are not alone! Keep connected with people who understand your situation.
text: • Anda tidak bersendirian! Terus berhubung dengan orang yang memahami situasi anda.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Share your challenges AND your successes.
text: • Kongsikan cabaran DAN kejayaan anda.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • It is normal to feel stressed, frustrated, and afraid at this time.
text: • Adalah normal untuk merasa tertekan, kecewa, dan takut pada masa ini.
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: • Be kind to yourself and take a break when you need to!
text: • Bersikap baik kepada diri sendiri dan berehat sebentar jika perlu!
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Children with disabilities need love, respect and time – just like any other child
text: Syabas kerana menambah kaedah lain dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Kanak-kanak kurang upaya memerlukan kasih sayang, rasa hormat dan masa - sama seperti kanak-kanak lain
note: This is for topic Children with Disabilities

sourceText: Sometimes we feel frustrated with our children because we expect them to behave in ways that they are not yet developmentally ready for.
text: Kadang kala kita merasa kecewa dengan anak-anak kita kerana kita mengharapkan mereka berkelakuan dengan cara yang mereka masih belum bersedia untuk melakukannya.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Introduction

sourceText: Learning about child development means we can have realistic expectations and spot any problems with their growth and development.
text: Belajar tentang perkembangan kanak-kanak bererti kita mempunyai harapan yang realistik dan dapat mengesan masalah berkaitan pertumbuhan dan perkembangan mereka.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Introduction

sourceText: All children develop at different rates. But there are some things that we expect children to be able to do at an age. These are called ‘development’ milestones.
text: Semua kanak-kanak membesar dengan kadar yang berbeza. Tetapi ada beberapa perkara yang kita jangkakan anak-anak dapat melakukannya pada usia tertentu. Ini disebut carta 'perkembangan'.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Introduction

sourceText: Many things affect our children's development. Development is helped by eating healthy food, having immunisations, and parents or caregivers who talk to children a lot.
text: Banyak perkara yang mempengaruhi perkembangan anak-anak. Perkembangan dapat dibantu dengan makan makanan yang sihat, melakukan imunisasi, dan ibu bapa atau penjaga yang banyak bercakap dengan anak-anak.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Introduction

sourceText: Babies from 0 to 1 year need a strong bond with a parent or caregiver who provides food, sleep, cleaning, comfort and safety. They need lots of play and attention - the most active time of brain development is during the first 1000 days of life!
text: Bayi dari usia 0 hingga 1 tahun memerlukan ikatan yang kuat dengan ibu bapa atau penjaga yang menyediakan makanan, tidur, kebersihan, keselesaan dan keselamatan. Mereka perlu banyak bermain dan perhatian - masa yang paling aktif bagi perkembangan otak adalah dalam tempoh 1000 hari pertama kehidupannya!
note: This is for topic Child Development - Babies & toddlers (0 - 2 years)

sourceText: * From 0 to 6 months, babies smile, babble and cry to attract your attention. We should provide care, cuddling and protection.
text: * Dari usia 0 hingga 6 bulan, bayi tersenyum, membebel dan menangis untuk menarik perhatian anda. Kita harus memberi penjagaan, pelukan dan perlindungan.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Babies & toddlers (0 - 2 years)

sourceText: * From 6 to 11 months, babies cling to you, especially when feeling insecure or frightened.
text: * Dari usia 6 hingga 11 bulan, bayi melekap pada anda, terutama ketika mereka rasa tidak selamat atau ketakutan.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Babies & toddlers (0 - 2 years)

sourceText: * From 12 months onwards, most babies start to walk, talk and explore things around them!
text: * Dari usia 12 bulan ke atas, kebanyakan bayi mula berjalan, bercakap dan meneroka sesuatu di sekitar mereka!
note: This is for topic Child Development - Babies & toddlers (0 - 2 years)

sourceText: Toddlers from 1 to 2 years become curious little explorers - watch out for climbing! They learn through play and trying things out. They want to learn how to do new things (like getting dressed) and make their own decisions. Praise them frequently to encourage them!
text: Kanak-kanak bertatih dari usia 1 hingga 2 tahun menjadi peneroka yang bersifat ingin tahu - berhati-hati apabila mereka memanjat! Mereka belajar melalui bermain dan mencuba sesuatu. Mereka ingin belajar bagaimana melakukan perkara baru (seperti berpakaian) dan membuat keputusan sendiri. Puji mereka selalu untuk menggalakkan mereka!
note: This is for topic Child Development - Babies & toddlers (0 - 2 years)

sourceText: Toddlers start learning new words and speaking in sentences. They do not like to lose, share or take turns, so use opportunities to start teaching them how to handle these situations calmly. They may express feelings in dramatic ways (like screaming on the floor!), but with your patient help, they can start to learn how to manage their feelings.
text: Kanak-kanak bertatih mula belajar perkataan baru dan bercakap menggunakan ayat. Mereka tidak suka kalah, berkongsi atau bergilir, jadi gunakan peluang ini untuk mula mengajar mereka bagaimana menangani situasi ini dengan tenang. Mereka mungkin meluahkan perasaan dengan cara yang dramatik (seperti menjerit di atas lantai!), tetapi dengan kesabaran anda, mereka mula belajar bagaimana menguruskan perasaan mereka.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Babies & toddlers (0 - 2 years)

sourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Knowing about child development can help you feel less frustrated by your children’s behaviour.
text: Syabas kerana menambah satu lagi alat dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Mengetahui tentang perkembangan anak dapat membantu anda merasa kurang kecewa dengan tingkah laku anak-anak anda.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Babies & toddlers (0 - 2 years)

sourceText: Young children from 2 to 5 years still have many of the same needs as toddlers. They learn through actions and play, and start developing friendships with other children. Young children often find it difficult to separate make-believe from reality. They may talk a lot and ask many questions. We should be honest when we reply! Our child may ask again if they don't understand or want to know more.
text: Kanak-kanak kecil dari usia 2 hingga 5 tahun masih mempunyai banyak keperluan yang sama seperti kanak-kanak bertatih. Mereka belajar melalui perlakuan dan bermain, dan mula menjalin persahabatan dengan kanak-kanak lain. Kanak-kanak sering merasa sukar untuk memisahkan antara apa yang dipercayai dengan realiti. Mereka mungkin banyak bercakap dan bertanya soalan. Kita harus jujur ​​semasa menjawab! Anak kita mungkin bertanya lagi jika mereka tidak faham atau ingin mengetahui lebih lanjut.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Children (2 - 9 years)

sourceText: Young children usually continue to express their feelings in dramatic ways, especially if they have to do something they don’t like! Keep teaching them patiently how to manage their emotions and responses if they lose, have to share, or need to take turns.
text: Kanak-kanak kecil lazimnya meluahkan perasaan mereka dengan cara yang dramatik, terutamanya jika mereka harus melakukan sesuatu yang mereka tidak suka! Teruskan mengajar mereka dengan sabar bagaimana mengurus emosi dan bertindak balas jika mereka kalah, perlu berkongsi, atau perlu bergilir.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Children (2 - 9 years)

sourceText: Older children of 6 to 9 years get more interested in learning at school and spending time with other children – they can be very active! Children may answer back to adults to show that they “know”. It is important to build your child’s independence and trust them to do simple and safe tasks without your assistance.
text: Kanak-kanak berumur 6 hingga 9 tahun lebih berminat untuk belajar di sekolah dan menghabiskan masa dengan kanak-kanak lain - mereka boleh menjadi sangat aktif! Kanak-kanak menjawab balik kepada orang dewasa untuk menunjukkan bahawa mereka "tahu". Penting untuk membina sikap berdikari anak dan mempercayai mereka melakukan tugas yang mudah dan selamat tanpa bantuan anda.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Children (2 - 9 years)

sourceText: At this age, children can be very self-conscious and sensitive, so recognise and speak with them about their emotions and about questions they may have around topics like religion. By now, they should be getting better at managing anger and frustration.
text: Pada usia ini, kanak-kanak boleh menjadi malu dan sensitif, jadi kenali dan bercakap dengan mereka mengenai emosi mereka dan tentang soalan mengenai topik seperti agama. Sekarang, mereka seharusnya lebih baik dalam menguruskan kemarahan dan kekecewaan.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Children (2 - 9 years)

sourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Knowing about child development can help you feel less frustrated by your children’s behaviour.
text: Syabas kerana menambah satu lagi alat dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Mengetahui tentang perkembangan anak dapat membantu anda merasa kurang kecewa dengan tingkah laku anak-anak anda.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Children (2 - 9 years)

sourceText: The teen years are the second most active time of brain development!
text: Masa remaja adalah tempoh masa kedua paling aktif dalam perkembangan otak!
note: This is for topic Child Development - Teenagers (10 - 17 years)

sourceText: Young teenagers of 10 to 12 years continue to gain interest in learning at school and spending time with other teens. Their interest in religion or spirituality may grow.
text: Remaja peringkat awal pada usia 10 hingga 12 tahun mempunyai minat untuk terus belajar di sekolah dan menghabiskan masa dengan remaja lain. Minat mereka terhadap agama atau kerohanian mungkin bertambah.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Teenagers (10 - 17 years)

sourceText: Young teenagers may answer back to you more frequently to show you they know “how”. They can feel very self-conscious and sensitive, so trust them to do more tasks independently to build their self-esteem. Continue to spend time with them, so you know what is going on in their lives and can help them manage difficult emotions like anger and frustration.
text: Remaja peringkat awal mungkin lebih kerap menjawab balik kepada anda untuk menunjukkan bahawa mereka tahu "bagaimana". Mereka amat peka kepada diri sendiri dan sensitif, jadi percayalah kepada mereka untuk berdikari melakukan tugas-tugas bagi membina estim diri mereka. Terus luangkan masa bersama mereka, jadi anda tahu apa yang sedang berlaku dalam hidup mereka dan dapat membantu mereka menguruskan emosi yang sukar seperti rasa marah dan kecewa.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Teenagers (10 - 17 years)

sourceText: Teenagers of 13 to 14 years can often feel insecure and confused. They need a lot of affection, reassurance, and encouragement to help them believe in their abilities. Their feelings get hurt easily, and they may have mood swings, act bossy, and be unhappy when they lose.
text: Remaja yang berusia antara 13 hingga 14 tahun sering merasa tidak selamat dan keliru. Mereka memerlukan banyak kasih sayang, keyakinan, dan dorongan untuk membantu mereka mempercayai kemampuan diri. Perasaan mereka mudah terluka, dan mereka mungkin mengalami perubahan mood, suka mengarah, dan tidak gembira apabila mereka kalah.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Teenagers (10 - 17 years)

sourceText: Their friends are increasingly important - also in their decision-making. They often begin to challenge rules that adults set for them at home or school. Make sure to give them some freedom, but also provide reliable rules that don’t change.
text: Rakan-rakan menjadi semakin penting - juga dalam membuat keputusan. Mereka sering mula mencabar peraturan yang ditetapkan orang dewasa di rumah atau sekolah. Berikan mereka sedikit kebebasan, tetapi pastikan peraturan yang boleh dipercayai yang tidak berubah.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Teenagers (10 - 17 years)

sourceText: Teenagers of 15 to 17 years are able to communicate with you about almost anything – though they may prefer being with peers more than with you. They can have exciting new ideas and ideals, as they form their own identity. Encourage them to begin to take responsibility for the future. Be patient and accepting of the person they are becoming - even if it is not what you had imagined!
text: Remaja berumur 15 hingga 17 tahun dapat berkomunikasi dengan anda mengenai hampir semua perkara - walaupun mereka lebih suka bersama rakan sebaya daripada anda. Mereka mungkin memiliki idea dan impian baru yang menarik, apabila mereka membina identiti mereka sendiri. Galakkan mereka untuk mula memikul tanggung jawab untuk masa depan. Bersabar dan menerima diri mereka - walaupun ia bukan seperti yang anda bayangkan!
note: This is for topic Child Development - Teenagers (10 - 17 years)

sourceText: Teenagers have a growing sense of their sexuality, so they need guidance to make safe and healthy choices. They may show risk-taking behaviours, frequent mood swings, and rebellious attitudes. Monitor who their friends are and have clear rules to keep them safe. Keep supporting them, loving them, and guiding them so they feel comfortable and secure.
text: Remaja mempunyai kepekaan seksualiti yang semakin meningkat, jadi mereka memerlukan bimbingan untuk membuat pilihan yang selamat dan sihat. Mereka mungkin menunjukkan tingkah laku mengambil risiko, perubahan mood yang kerap, dan sikap memberontak. Pantau siapa rakan mereka dan buat peraturan yang jelas untuk memastikan mereka selamat. Terus menyokong, menyayangi, dan membimbing mereka sehingga mereka merasa selesa dan selamat.
note: This is for topic Child Development - Teenagers (10 - 17 years)

sourceText: Well done for adding another tool to your Parenting Toolkit! Knowing about child development can help you feel less frustrated by your children’s behaviour.
text: Syabas kerana menambah satu lagi kaedah dalam Kit Keibubapaan anda! Mengetahui tentang perkembangan anak dapat membantu anda merasa kurang kecewa dengan tingkah laku anak-anak anda.
